description: When Dwarf Fortress should automatically save your game. If this is "NONE", Dwarf Fortress never saves your game for you. Possible values are "NONE", "SEASONAL" and "YEARLY".
name: Autosave

description: If this is "YES", Dwarf Fortress will back up your save file each time it autosaves your game.
name: Automatic Save Backup

description: If Dwarf Fortress should pause the game each time it autosaves for you.
name: Pause on Autosave

description: If this is "YES", Dwarf Fortress will save the game immediately after you embark.
name: Initial Save

description: Where to display the number of idling dwarves. The value can be either "TOP", "BOTTOM", or "OFF".
name: Idler Display Location

description: You can set the maximum population of your fortress here.  Keep in mind that your population must be at least 80 to get a king and 100 to obtain the current game features.  The strict cap also stops fort births.  Both caps can be violated by a few special cases, like the arrival of the monarch if you qualify.
name: Population Cap

description: You can set the maximum population of your fortress here.  Keep in mind that your population must be at least 80 to get a king and 100 to obtain the current game features.  The strict cap also stops fort births.  Both caps can be violated by a few special cases, like the arrival of the monarch if you qualify.
name: Strict Population Cap

description: This allows you to control the number of babies+children in your fortress.  The first number is an absolute cap on the number of babies+children.  The second is a percentage of the current number of adults in your fortress (the default is the essentially meaningless 1000% here).  The lower number is used as the cap.  The cap only prevents further pregnancies, so migrant children, multiple births and existing pregnancies from old saves can still push you over the cap.  Setting either number to zero will disallow pregnancies in the fortress.
name: Baby and Child Cap

description: If "YES", Dwarf Fortress starts Fortress mode paused.
name: Pause on load

description: Turns on or off temperature calculations. If temperature calculations are off, only a few direct temperature changes will take place. For example, magma will set tiles and creatures to high temperatures, but those tiles will never cool and those creatures will not catch fire. Effects that rely on temperature calculations, such as water freezing, melting, or evaporating, or creatures and items taking temperature-related damage, will not occur.
name: Temperature

description: Turns on or off weather. If weather is off it will never rain or snow.
name: Weather

description: Turns on or off the fortress mode dwarven economy. This has no effect, since the economy does not function in v0.40.
name: Economy

description: Turns on or off fortress mode sieges. Turning this off for your first couple of games may make the game easier to start with.
name: Invaders

description: If this is "YES" it is possible for cave-ins to occur.
name: Cave-ins

description: Turns on or off strange moods and the resulting artifacts.
name: Artifacts

description: If this is "YES", when the dwarven economy kicks in all rooms will cost nothing, allowing even the poorest of haulers to have a room fit for a king. This has no effect, since the economy does not function in the current version.
name: Zero Rent

description: Turns on or off the testing arena.
name: Testing Arena

description: Turns on or off the spread of blood spatter and other contaminants between creatures and ground tiles in Fortress mode. As contaminants are buggy and can have a major negative impact on FPS in Fortress mode, it is recommended to leave this set at "NO" for now.
name: Walking Spreads Spatter (Fortress Mode)

description: Turns on or off the spread of blood spatter and other contaminants between creatures and ground tiles in Adventurer mode.
name: Walking Spreads Spatter (Adventurer Mode)

description: The path finding costs associated with different traffic values.
name: Path Cost

description: When building a burial receptacle, the option to allow pets to be buried in it will default to NO if this is set to "YES".
name: Default to no pets in coffins

description: N/A
name: STORE_DIST_ITEM_DECREASE

description: N/A
name: STORE_DIST_SEED_COMBINE

description: N/A
name: STORE_DIST_BUCKET_COMBINE

description: N/A
name: STORE_DIST_BARREL_COMBINE

description: N/A
name: STORE_DIST_BIN_COMBINE

description: If "YES" Dwarf Fortress will display the quality of an item's improvements in the name. If you get annoyed by seeing items like *<*sword*>* you can get rid of the outside ** by setting this to NO.
name: Show improvment quality in name

description: If "YES", inspecting engravings and artifacts in Fortress Mode will have an extended history displayed.
name: Show all history in Dwarf Mode

description: If this is "YES", Dwarf Fortress will log the reason why maps were rejected during world gen in the log.txt file.
name: Log map rejects

description: If this is "YES", Dwarf Fortress will log the reason why maps were rejected during world gen in the log.txt file.
name: Graze Coefficient

description: N/A
name: MORE

description: N/A
name: Display Length

description: If you set this to "YES" your adventurer will trigger the traps of your old fortresses
name: Adventurer Traps

description: N/A
name: Adventurer Always Center

description: N/A
name: Adventurer Always Center

description: N/A
name: Adventurer Z Views

description: N/A
name: Dwarf Nickname

description: N/A
name: Adventurer Nickname

description: N/A
name: Dwarf Nickname

description: If this value is YES, then it will always pop up a warning screen when you embark (Like you get when you have Salt Water or an Aquifer on-site)
name: Always Embark Warning

description: N/A
name: Show Embark Tunnel

description: The size of the default embark site.
name: Embark Rectangle Size

description: N/A
name: WOUND_COLOR_NONE

description: N/A
name: WOUND_COLOR_MINOR

description: N/A
name: WOUND_COLOR_INHIBITED

description: N/A
name: WOUND_COLOR_FUNCTION_LOSS

description: N/A
name: WOUND_COLOR_BROKEN

description: N/A
name: WOUND_COLOR_MISSING

description: The tile and color of areas that are far below the currently displayed z level. The format is SKY:<character>:<foreground color>:<background color>:<brightness>. <character> can be either an ASCII number or a character in single quotes, like '#'.
name: SKY

description: The tile and color of areas that are far below the currently displayed z level while indoors. The format is the same as for SKY above.
name: CHASM

description: The tile displayed for pillars. Pillars are created at the ends of strings of wall tiles.
name: Pillar Tile

description: If this is "YES" the ground will be varied randomly using the tiles ,.`'. If this is "NO", only the period will be used for ground tiles.
name: Varied Ground Tiles

description: If this is "YES", all engravings are displayed initially looking the same, like highlighted smooth walls/floors. Otherwise, they'll be displayed as a tile of one of the things they depict. Either way, a given engraving's behavior can be changed through designation.
name: Obscured Engravings

description: If "YES" Dwarf Fortress displays water as numbers from 1-7 indicating depth.
name: Show water flow amounts
